I've finish reading the book and I'll give you my thoughts on this book:
no! this book is not about anti-semitism, it focus on how USSR are more corrupt and dangerous to the entire human race than the NAZI are. gulag camp? forced worker? slavery on their own civilian? those kind of things didn't happen in Germany or any other country occupied NAZI. in Germany, the people there didn't like the concept of communism, that's why they chose NAZI Party in their vote.

this book also teaches us about thinking out of the box/thinking alternatively about what if history was like this and what if I chose this direction. it stimulates us another point of view of our world and history. our history are written by the winner and also... by WHOM HAS THE MOST CASUALTIES (that would be the Jews), that makes us wonder why WW2 history too much focus on the holocaust of Jews but neglect on other citizen like the French people or the Dutch who also have many casualties.

there are a lot of to talk about but it's better that you read it yourself. gives you insight and some truth in it.
This is probably the most disgusting anti-semitic piece of crap I've ever seen.
